definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

pinyin: fa1 zuo4 xing4 shi4 shui4 bing4

sentences.english: Yes, since I had it , the attack was stopped.
sentences.chinese: 有用，自從我吃藥後發作就停止了。

sentences.english: But the onset of dementia invites no ceremony, no grieving.
sentences.chinese: 癡呆症的發作沒有預兆，也沒有哀悼。

sentences.english: I’ll never give it up. It helps with the panic attacks.
sentences.chinese: 我不會停止使用它們，它們對驚慌的發作有幫助。

sentences.english: When sudden outbreak scant of breath and foot pain.
sentences.chinese: 突然發作呼吸困難和腳痛時。

sentences.english: Migraines are one of the few neurological disorders to subside with age.
sentences.chinese: 偏頭痛是隨着年齡發作率遞減的神經系統疾病之一。

sentences.english: The Wolf Man is a terrorizing half-man, half-wolf creature that strikes during the full moon.
sentences.chinese: 恐怖的狼人是一種半人半狼的怪物，在滿月時分發作。

sentences.english: It is clinically divided into the stage of attack and chronic remission stage.
sentences.chinese: 臨牀上可分爲發作期和慢性緩解期。

sentences.english: The problem for me is it seems to come in waves.

sentences.english: If you have high blood pressure, you will be more susceptible to a heart attack or stroke.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有血壓高，你會更容易受到心臟病發作或中風。

sentences.english: Also some rests assume the seasonal outbreak, many spring is taken bad in the fall.
sentences.chinese: 也有的息者呈季節性發作，多在秋春季發病。

sentences.english: Cheating on the diet—such as eating a candy bar—can bring on a seizure in minutes.
sentences.chinese: 在飲食上作弊，比如喫塊方糖，會馬上引起癲癇發作。

sentences.english: This stock is then used while that change-over is happening.
sentences.chinese: 這是股票，然後用，而這種變化超越正在發作的事情。

sentences.english: Snow shoveling is a known trigger for heart attacks.
sentences.chinese: 剷雪是一個已知的心臟病發作激發因素。

sentences.english: Prevents when the outbreak the accident is this kind of patient You Ying pays attention, on the one hand.
sentences.chinese: 防止發作時意外是該類患者尤應注意的一方面。

sentences.english: In 1923, Harding died of a sudden heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 1923年，哈丁死於突發性心臟病發作。

definition: to recur (of a disease)/to reappear/to relapse (into a former bad state)
to have a high temperature/feverish/unable to think calmly/to emit heat
to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
